1_1vAdpJiyYEHcDZoJn93QcjzaFVKHHPg1F.body:
IIRC, it's normal to get this "Content publish failed" message when you try to publish just after you created a site, since noone is hosting it besides you.

AFAIK, this "publish" function only tells peers that already host your site to update their copies immediately.
As soon as you sign your site, it's available on ZeroNet.

Try posting your site address on
http://127.0.0.1:43110/Sites.ZeroNetwork.bit/
or
http://127.0.0.1:43110/0list.bit/
or even here on ZeroTalk.

If people complain they can't access it or the connected peers number doesn't increase, you may need to open port 15441 on your router.

2_1GmJVE6KmMyRKKfEg2aiTjCtCU5poP3Rde.body:
> [obiwanzanobi](#comment_38_1LUy9iAxeWsj1DP5L8V17Yb2vo87FucjgD): what does it mean "content.json does not exist"?

content.json is the site's metadata file, it contains the list of files, their hash, owner signature, etc.
If this file can't be loaded, the site can't be loaded.

It's weird 'cause I get around 40 peers but still can't download content.json for that site.

It worries me a bit, since there have been some questions like "How do I DoS a Zite" popping up lately on ZeroTalk...

So, I managed to access that zite through a Zeronet proxy and Kaffie is right, it's definitely a joke.
The seizure image has Silk Road's logo on it.

False alarm, folks.

I was looking at ZeroTorrent.bit's data folder and, for some reason, lots of entries are missing their .torrent files. Not sure what went wrong there, but it seems those files weren't properly uploaded.


Anyway, you can use the zite Play for movie magnet links.

Here's a link to that movie on Play:
http://127.0.0.1:43110/1PLAYgDQboKojowD3kwdb3CtWmWaokXvfp/?page=1&search=under%2Bthe%2Bskin&imdb_id=tt1441395&title=Under+the+Skin
